relation: Categories
Greek Life
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Bang for the buck
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
You have choices
No certain type of student that should or can attend this campus. Lipscomb is for everyone and anyone.
The only thing I was not used to was that during Chapel the singing is done all Acapella.
You will get out of it what you put into it
Clubs, sororities, sports, mission trips/studying abroad, and community service. Enjoy!!!

The food court has a variety of options that you can choose from such as Chik-Fil-A, Starbucks, a pizza joint, Aunty Anne, etc. If you don't really want something on campus there are a few places around campus to eat at.
I don't live on campus but I have been told that they aren't that bad. As commonly known, living on campus does allow you to meet people and stay connected with what's happening on campus.

Totally get involved in whatever clubs, sports, and extracurricular activities you are interested in. Yes, college is about furthering your education but you might as well have some fun along the way. Chapel may seem boring, a waste of time, and irrelevant to your life but I will say that it is worth opening up to and trying to enjoy despite the distractions around you.

Lipscomb has an excellent Christian atmosphere that is not demanding that attendees convert but allows the students to explore and grow as they experience Christ more. Lipscomb is student-oriented and makes sure that there are events, clubs, seminars, etc that students are interested in. The professors at this University really want their students to succeed and have an open door policy which allows you to establish a one-on-one relationship with them.
pageTitle: Lipscomb University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {11359=I love Lipscomb! The people, the atmosphere, the social activities, the academics - Lipscomb is just a great place to be. I have made many friends here that I know will be friends for life. Lipscomb's Student Government Association plans 4-5 activities per semester to help students stay involved on campus. The biggest event SGA planned in the 2010 fall semester was Lipscomb's first Paint Rave. With over 600 students in attendance, the rave was a huge success! Also, Garner Goode with Lipscomb in Motion (the student life events planner), has events on the school calendar almost every night. From free food in Arlo's to a movie night in Alumni Auditorium, students are never without access to a good time. Social clubs (Lipscomb's alternative to sororities/fraternities) and athletic events also give students a chance to interact outside of the classroom and spend time together. Lipscomb's service clubs give students the chance to enjoy some of the same aspects of a social club, while finding ways to give back to the community. Lipscomb is located in Nashville, giving students total access to the famous, music city. Within minutes of the Grand Ole Opry, Opryland, Green Hills mall, Sweet CeCe's and so much more, students are able to have fun off campus without having to use up a lot of gas., 159808=If you plan to commute, plan on 8:00 classes or plan to park off-campus and hike to class. Also, consider that this is a Christian school. If you're uncomfortable with Christianity/Christians/religion in general, you may not feel comfortable, as it is very open about its stand on faith (though never shove-it-down-your-throat) and you are required to get chapel credits by attending chapel/chapel-like events., 120796=Be prepared to pay at least $2000 in hidden fees. Get used to studying a a lot. Have fun!, 59337=the dorms look amazing and I already got a roommate. I get to move into my dorm in august., 168009=The food id pretty predictable and the cafe closes at 7:30 so that's a struggle., 247965=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Don't get me wrong. Lipscomb is a prestigious school. It's all in the price tag. The money I am paying is worth it though. The SGA and the College Ministry Team are always providing free food or some kind of fun activity for the students. Am enjoying being here I couldn't stand the size of certain other campuses I visted (like Kennesaw State). The size of Lipscomb's campus is perfect for those who want an easy transition into college life. Not only is the campus the perfect size it also has the best activities for any mood you might be in. The food is superb and the recently added Chick-Fil-A is my favorite of all the fast food places on campus. The surrounding area is perfect for riding bikes or running and Nashville is a college town so you will never be bored. There is always something to do. I have 3 more years to go at Lipscomb and I'm gonna love every step of the journey. Am learning a lot The courses at Lipscomb are no joke. Strenuous and fast paced, the work and the professors will keep you on your toes. Login to rate or flag the reviews
